intro: Bidens scopulorum, commonly known as rock ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open woodland or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with dark centers. Bidens scopulorum is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments, making it a resilient and hardy species.
